title: The Crown season 3: Helen Bonham Carter spoke to Princess Margaret ghost
text:
Helena Bonham Carter spoke to Princess Margaret’s ghost to get her permission to star in The Crown series 3 (Picture: Getty/Netflix)

Helena Bonham Carter claims that in order to sign on to The Crown’s third season she contacted the late Princess Margaret via a medium to ask for her permission to play her.

Helena is succeeding Vanessa Kirby in the role but apparently she always consults a medium before she plays a dead person and this was no exception.

‘When you play someone real, you really want their blessing because you do have a responsibility,’ the Oscar-nominated actress explained to an audience at Cheltenham literary festival.

Bonham Carter is replacing Vanessa Kirby in the role, who won a BAFTA for her performance of the Princess (Picture: REX()

Apparently, she and Princess Margaret had ‘a little chat’.

The Queen’s younger sister died in 2002, but Helena said she also got some much-needed advice from Margaret on how to get her portrayal just right.

‘She said, “But you’re going to have to brush up and be more groomed and neater,” the actress told The Guardian in a separate interview. ‘Then she said, “Get the smoking right. I smoked in a very particular way. Remember that – this is a big note – the cigarette holder was as much a weapon for expression as it was for smoking.”‘

The 53-year-old had previously opened up about how she found playing the princess a ‘daunting’ prospect, especially following Vanessa’s footsteps.

Olivia Colman and Tobias Menzies take over the leading roles in the new series of The Crown (Picture: Netflix)

‘It’s daunting, definitely daunting. Vanessa has just won a Bafta and she’s brilliant,’ Helena said. ‘And in a way you have the ghost of the real Margaret and the ghost of the actress who played her. You also have the fact everyone has an opinion about the woman and yet ultimately very few people knew what her private life was like and that’s the sort of the joy of the job.’

Season three of The Crown will drop on Netflix on November 17, and will see a complete overhaul of the show’s major cast. Gone are Claire Foy and Matt Smith as Queen Elizabeth II and Prince Phillp and in are newly-minted Oscar-winner Olivia Colman and Tobias Menzies.

We’ve already seen our first glimpse at Josh O’Connor and Emma Corrin as Charles and Diana as the fourth season of the show is already filming. Sadly, those picketing for Helen Mirren to return to her role as The Queen for the show’s latter seasons will be sorely disappointed.
